org.relationlearn.model

Class DigraphImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.relationlearn.model.DigraphImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Iterable<ArgumentNode>, RelationDigraph

    public class DigraphImpl
extends Object
implements RelationDigraph
    RelationDigraph implementation that stores the ArgumentNode objects in a Map.
    See Also:
    RelationDigraph, Map

      Constructor and Description
      DigraphImpl()
      Constucts a new empty DigraphImpl.

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addArgumentNode(ArgumentNode node)
      Adds a new ArgumentNode to this RelationDigraph.
      boolean containsNode(int nodeId)
      Checks if this RelationDigraph has a node stored with the id equal to nodeId.
      ArgumentNode getArgumentNode(int nodeId)
      Returns the ArgumentNode with id equal to nodeId.
      Iterator<ArgumentNode> iterator()
      Returns an Iterator that iterates through the graph's ArgumentNode objects in postorder.
      String toString()
      Returns a String representation of this DigraphImpl and its content by recursively calling each ArgumentNode toString method.

        Parameters:

      • containsNode

        public boolean containsNode(int nodeId)
        Description copied from interface: RelationDigraph
        Checks if this RelationDigraph has a node stored with the id equal to nodeId.
        Specified by:
        containsNode in interface RelationDigraph
        Parameters:
        nodeId - the id of the ArgumentNode to look for existence in the RelationDigraph object.
        Returns:
        true if there's a node with id equal to nodeId, false otherwise.

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Returns a String representation of this DigraphImpl and its content by recursively calling each ArgumentNode toString method.
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
        Returns:
        a String representation of this DigraphImpl and its internal content

      • iterator

        public Iterator<ArgumentNode> iterator()
        Returns an Iterator that iterates through the graph's ArgumentNode objects in postorder.

        Note: This iterator expects the graph to contain an ArgumentNode with id equal to 1, which is considered the root node (the only node that doesn't have its target relation value set).

        Specified by:
        iterator in interface Iterable<ArgumentNode>
        Returns:
        an Iterator that traverses the graph's nodes in postorder
        See Also:
        Iterator, Iterable
